name: SAMHSA National Helpline
description: SAMHSA's National Helpline is a free, confidential, 24/7 treatment referral and information service for individuals and families facing mental health and/or substance use disorders.
fullDescription: SAMHSA's National Helpline is a free, confidential, 24/7 treatment referral and information service for individuals and families facing mental health and/or substance use disorders.
whatTheyOffer:
- 24/7 confidential support
- Treatment referrals in your area
- Information about mental health and substance use
- Support in English and Spanish
- Referrals to local support groups
- Information about state-funded treatment programs
- Help finding sliding-scale or free treatment
howToGetIt: Call 1-800-662-4357 anytime, 24/7, 365 days a year. Specialists will connect you with local treatment facilities, support groups, and community organizations. TTY available at 1-800-487-4889.
keywords: SAMHSA, substance abuse, addiction, mental health, treatment referral, drug treatment, alcohol treatment, free treatment
